posts.post_content: Everyone has mentioned Kiln Fiend but I personally like Wee Dragonauts better because of evasion (but I'm a little biased towards nostalgia). Also don't forget Chandra's Spitfire and Gelectrode for additional lullz with Dminish to clear the board for cheap. And since I'm on the topic of Ravnica, [Schismotivate](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Schismotivate) @.@ and [Izzet Guildmage](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Izzet Guildmage).

posts.post_content:
Step 1: Cast [Shock](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Shock) (or [Lightning Bolt](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lightning Bolt) if you're outside of standard)  
Step 2: Activate [Garruk, Primal Hunter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Garruk, Primal Hunter)'s -3 and draw 8 cards  
Step 3: Did they really let all of that happen?? Wow, you get to do whatever you want now.

posts.post_content:
This belongs in a land destruction deck. R/G with [Bramblecrush](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bramblecrush) and [Tectonic Rift](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Tectonic Rift). Keep getting the spells back and keep the pressure on. Also, you'll have green to mana ramp. Tectonic Rift basically means you get to swing for 8 unblocked.  
  
  
4.5/5

4.5/5

posts.post_content:
Staggering in limited play. Also widely overlooked - I've lucked into them over and over and people consistently need to have the powers restated, then they sigh or swear and often give up.   
  
Probably not going to win any tournaments with Titans/Dismember in vogue, but high marks on the tier below.
